title: Magistrate, 68, and his MUCH younger court clerk fiancée, 23, 'are trying for a BABY'
text:
A 68-year-old magistrate and his 23-year-old court clerk are planning to have a baby together after getting engaged last month.

Grandfather-of-eight Rod Higgins met Ashleigh Petrie while living next door to her in Shepparton, northern Victoria.

Mr Higgins was made a magistrate in 2017 and Miss Petrie was a guest at his celebration party.

Last year they started a secret relationship which was discovered by colleagues around six months ago and reported in The Herald Sun this week.

Love is in the air: A 68-year-old magistrate and his 23-year-old court clerk (pictured) are planning to have a baby together after getting engaged last month

Grandfather-of-eight Rod Higgins met Ashleigh Petrie (pictured) while living next door to her in Shepparton, northern Victoria

Their relationship continued and last month Mr Higgins proposed during a romantic holiday in Fiji.

Miss Petrie excitedly accepted and called him 'the love of her life' in a gushing Facebook post where she showed off pictures of her sparkly new ring.

Sources told the Herald Sun that the pair have even discussed starting a family together.

Their relationship continued and last month and Mr Higgins proposed during a romantic holiday in Fiji. Pictured: The couple on holiday

Magistrate Rodney Higgins proposed to his girlfriend Ashleigh Petrie, 23, in September. She is pictured right and left with her ring

Miss Petrie excitedly accepted the proposal and called Mr Higgins 'the love of her life' in a gushing Facebook post

During their trip the pair went zip lining, met a Fijian tribe and swam in the sea together as they made several romantic social media posts

The relationship became public after it raised eyebrows among lawyers and has been disclosed to Victoria's chief magistrate Peter Lauritsen.

A spokesman for Mr Lauritsen said: 'The Chief Magistrate has no comment on the personal lives of magistrates or staff.'

Miss Petrie announced her engagement to the father-of-three on Facebook.

'What an amazing 10 days it has been here in Fiji! Firstly, I arrived as Rod's girlfriend and I leave as rod fiancé! I cannot wait to become Mrs Higgins!' she wrote online.

'It started with a crush and now I have a ring on my finger. The love of my life asked me to marry him and I said YESSSS.'

'I don't know how I got so lucky to find such a sweet and caring man with the same sense of humour, this amazing man is the love of my life!'

During their trip the pair went zip lining, met a Fijian tribe and swam in the sea together as they made several romantic social media posts.
